properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The extreme heat wave will persist until tomorrow. A warm and humid air mass continues to affect Southern Quebec. The temperatures are not expected to fall below 20 degrees Celsius tonight. Temperatures will be cooler on Saturday, however the combined temperature and humidity values will still produce humidex values between 35 and 37. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-11T15:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T02:05:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0603576811.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This evening, conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-11T07:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T03:52:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3093533313.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is possible today. Hazard: Heavy rain producing local rainfall rates of 25 to 50 mm per hour. Total rainfall amounts will vary significantly, however local amounts of 50 to 100 mm are possible. Localized flooding is possible. Timing: Now through this afternoon. A rainfall warning may be required for some areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-11T21:35:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T05:36:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3537160568.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very warm weather is expected to continue. Time span: continuing until Saturday. Minimum temperature tonight: near 20 degrees Celsius. Maximum temperature Saturday: near 29 degrees Celsius. Locations: Upper Lake Melville. Remarks: Very warm temperatures will continue into Saturday as the warm air mass persists over the Upper Lake Melville area. Showers are expected to follow by Saturday evening, bringing somewhat cooler temperatures for the remainder of the weekend. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please call HealthLine 811 for advice on health risks, symptoms and precautions associated with heat. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-11T16:39:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T00:40:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583364855.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:36 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 40 km east of Beauval and is moving east at 35 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-11T07:52:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T05:37:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3109315462.2020
Area: Île à la Crosse and Beauval
